text review: i love this hostal, the staff its very nice, i recommend it especially for young people. breakfast perfect. and they have a very nice dog. really i dont understand the bad reviews.

i had a good stay at the hostel. i met many friendly people and everybody was happy to be there, including the staff.  it has a centric location and is great if you don‚Äôt mind a 1 hour commute in transit to get to major destinations.   my one issue during my stay was that i was hit with a wooden board from the top bed that fell on my head.

amazing people, location and food that they serve there daily. although i wasn‚Äôt informed about a bed bug situation that had been brought to their attention about my exact same bed one week prior to my visit. i woke up the next day with extreme bites all over my body. if you don‚Äôt want to be bitten, book another hostel. btw, if you even set your things down on the floor, they‚Äôre prone to carrying bugs.
very nice place. in a quiet neighborhood

thank you all! 2nd time at your location and i really y enjoyed both stays. i look forward to next year. always an adventure.   oh, and tyler, you rock!!! please send me any dates or info on carlos. i hope he does well in his upcoming pursuits!  sincerely, dan c

unfortunately my stay at the anderson estates was a lot worse than i had expected. i read previous reviews and had an idea of what i was getting myself into but i didn't expect to be treated as poorly as i was by the staff. they had assigned my bed to somebody else without informing me or assigning me to a new bed. i had nowhere to sleep my first night and the office was closed. when i went to resolve the issue the staff blamed it on me and did not apologize or feel bad at all.

pretty chill atmosphere, definitely a place for young people. we stayed in a private room and i thought they were joking at first but they gave us this ancient skeleton key for the door that was difficult to use. not a great location, the neighborhood isn't very sketchy its just far away from things if you don't have a car. we got tap cards but the metro wasn't great either. would have taken us over an hour to get to the beach or other places we wanted to go.

you don't even get what you pay for. the communal kitchen was always dirty. the entire house smelled like urine and weed.  male workers came into female dorms without even knocking (it happen to all of us staying in the dorm, they came in when my roommate was getting dressed).  there are  no lockers, rooms don't have locks (everything is open, no keys), no curtains (not even in the restroom).  i've been to hostels around the world, i never thought the usa one would be so disappointing.

sit by the pool or deep in it; the staff is friendly, and unlike in many other places i stayed they actually want to be here doing what they do.    some guests are possible transplants to la others are just travelers, so you have the right balance. there is also an unwritten code of respect for personal space and privacy, so if you have to work or write that important email, there is the silence and space to do that.    metro is walking distance, and you can go directly to st monica or downtown! :)

it's definitely a hostel worth checking out. friendly and helpful staff and the facilities are just something else. quite a fancy hostel i'd say. better than average breakfast and you even get served. nice pool area with a real possibility to sunbathe so if you're lazy enough or too tired you don't even have to hit the beach necessarily.  price is fair and it feels good to pay for the stay with these guys. the metro station is close by which really makes moving around very easy and convenient .
clean hostel , near the subway, economical place and friendly staff
won't stay here again
perfect place to be located, very easy to get everywhere & such friendly staff. incredible value for money!! 10/10

well, i guess you get what you pay for. unfortunately we were late due to my plane being delayed, so my friend and i were both charged with a  late check-in fee (although we had called before). this fee was stupid- all staff members actually live on the hostel ground and are up, partying all night anyway. the rooms were fine, the beds very comfortable. there were ants everywhere though. you can not lock your belongings. bathrooms were meeh, ok. my friend was put in the wrong room, too.
good place to stay, great atmosphere and only a short walk from metro transport

this place has a great vibe and is very close to la! walking distance to metro. overall a great experience!  i just want to give some tips just about minor things. the outside bathrooms were a bit dirty and not always stocked (toilet paper, no shelf in 1 bathroom). the sink is outside of the 2 bathrooms, and it was very small with no shelf to put your stuff, except for a brick ledge. the shared room we had didn't have a lock, which was a bit concerning. the kitchen was small and unorganized.

the place was disgusting. there were ants all over my bed and next to my bed. no security what so ever. no locks on the doors or lockers to put belongings in. there weren't even blinds on all the windows so any one could look into my room which was severely cramped. toilets were dirty and hard to access. didn't end up staying a single night there, left as soon as i could. couldn't get a refund, staff were rude. book the hostel in santa monica instead and you'll have a lot more value for money.
there are a lot of ants, which irritated me. and few restrooms compared to the number of guests.
great hostel- don't really get the bad reviews. staff are really nice and its great value for money. good breakfast with a lot of choice. great hostel.

bad things:  filthy  in a dodgy neighborhood  no locks on doors or secure places for passport  2.5km from nearest grocery store  literally four inches between beds and no side tables or benches for laying stuff out which meant people left stuff all over the floor  someone stole my scarf and all my food  one room had no privacy at all and was ground floor with no curtains on french window style doors        good things:  solid wifi  good breakfast  tv with some games consoles  pool
great place! free amenities! friendly staff and guests, perfect for traveling artists, musicians, and actors.

staff are very nice and helpful. they clean quite a bit, but the facilities themselves are old and falling apart. showers were disgusting. one leaked constantly and flooded the bath. great location; 15 min walk from the train. no air conditioning can make sleeping difficult in the summer (it looked like some rooms had window units, but not mine). breakfast is pretty good. lots of mosquitoes by the pool. i got bit every night. overall weird vibe. no close stores/alcohol.
i had a amazing time /stay
great atmosphere, having the pool as the social area, only 10 mins walk from the expo metro line. great value, the neighbourhood has many shops in walking distance.

normally staying at an hostel your expectations for cleanliness aren't that high but if you have to pay a $15 dollar fee per person for it you would hope that you would see where that money goes.to begin with their was lice in my bed, yes.every morning i would wake up with bites around my whole body, it wasn' until the my last day that i saw one moving around my sheets, the bathrooms are decent but the showers are disgusting, you can tell that no one has clean those showers with bleach in weeks.

if you're staying in la and want to meet all kinds of beautiful people from around the world then this is the only place to stay. location was great and the mansion itself blew my mind. the pool is amazing and the staff are great. loved it!

saw the reviews on this and was pleasantly surprised when i saw it. swimming pool, cool people, super cheap, breakfast was decent, area was a little dodgy but i walked around at night and lived to tell the tail so it's all good. i left my laptop in my room and didn't get stolen so nothing but good things to say about the place

i was worried i had brought bedbugs back with me for about a month.. saw some beg bug spray left out in room and some people in my room were bit by something.. place was a mess nice staff.. wasn't horrible.. wasn't amazing.. had to walk a few blocks to get a free breakfast..

if you are looking for the nastiest, most ghetto hostel in la, look no further, from sheets with blood, this 3rd world hostel will not disappoint you, come and stay at la's greatest show. from living rooms and other amenities rooms changed to bunk beds, to bathrooms barely accesible. prepare yourself for a thrilling experience of getting into a lottery of who's staying at the 'mansion' and who will be staying at some random unfinished house from a nearby area.

loved the security guard at the front of the street. very kind individual, everyone gave off great vibes.    get some locks!   was totally blown away that not only did the dorms not have locks, but there was no locker option. very unnerving to go to outl all day and have to cross fingers your belongings would be there/untampered with when returning at night.      luckily everyone was great and there were no issues,  with the amount of traffic coming through it only takes 1 bad seed to spoil it all.

it seems lots has been said both positive and negative about this place.  let's start with positive- some staff were very helpful and assisted when an issue arose. pool was inviting. cool old house other guests are good to hang with. breakfast is free and fills a hole. washing is free. the area while appears dodgy locals were really friendly, its safe and close to metro. security on main road too.  neg- some staff not friendly. too few  bathrooms, no locks on rooms.
amazing place! loved staying here. everyone was extremely friendly and the vibe is rad.

the hostel was pictured and marketed far beyond its actual standards. the security was almost next to nothing, with no lockers and no way to lock our rooms. the fact that the toilets were only in some rooms and were 'shared' meant that people kept entering the rooms with toilets. the floor was so dirty, the towels were not washed properly.
felt like home. exactly what needed after 12h flight. staff is very friendly and helpful.
hadi was really nice..
great place with awesome staff and guests, lovely (clean) pool. had a really great time here. not very close to downtown la or the beaches, but it is close to a metro train station though!

my favourite place, honestly is a home away from home. the staff are incredibly friendly (special shout out to hadi who helped us order pizza) lovely atmosphere and great location, near to train station and and bus stops and local food supermarket close by. definitely will stay again
there was no lock in rooms and even in the house.  we smelled a gas from the stove area.  we didn't feel safe.  it smelled like damp and the furnishing wasn't working properly (ie. windows, shower).

door to room was unlocked all of the time.  had a problem with ants in the room and the member of staff we brought the issue up to told us it was our fault for having food in the room (there was no food in the room) anf got somebody to just sweep the ants out. other than that single issue, the hostel was amazing

poor management at this hostel, got placed in another property away from the main house and it's facilities. they didn't mention anything about numerical locks on the front door to the property i was placed in so i'm glad i didn't stay out too late and get locked out. just all around an unpleasant but liveable experience. very unorganized process and little to no explanation of things. would not recommend or stay here again.
the staff were nice enough i guess, but they moved us to another property riddled with problems. friend of mine even for a bad skin infection from the bed. would not recommend to anyone.

a very pleasant place. with a very laidback staff and an welcoming atmosphere. definitely  good for the backpacker and a younger crowd. access to a nice swimming pool and a relative close distance to the metro that can take you in to downtown was a big plus.

you do get you money's worth here. $35 a night for decent sleeping quarters, walk in showers, they serve breakfast for you, they have a pool, and 10 minutes from train. the downsides were the atmosphere (guests and staff were somewhat reserved and doing their own thing; no events here) and the hostel is open door as in they don't lock the doors. even though it is in a college town, in a family neighborhood, and is claimed to be safe i would have felt more comfortable with it being more secure.
fun, fond memories of the old days of radio, an eclectic site, with parking the biggest difficulty.  for the money, it was fantastically good, at $ 22 a night
staff members are kind and the laundry is for free.

between hosteworld and anderson estates my booking was completely messed up   i got a email from anderson to let me know that even though i had a booking confirmation i was charged a shared room rate for a private room which is what i booked.. a private room. after many emails i was still not guaranteed the private room even though i was aled to pay a higher price which i was prepared to do. i also called them ten times with no answer. when i arrived there on the day there was no private room ac

clean, friendly staff, awesome pool.. if any extra, staff shares their staff meals with you too..thats a bonus! besides that, its evident they try to accomodate you to the best of their resources and capabilities.. to all visiting backpackers, wash your used dishes immediately please. it's counterproductive for the staff who cleans, when you leave dishes in the sink and you complain about roaches etc..  otherwise, all's fine and dandy...

this hostel is perfect for  people who want to meet other travellers and hang out together, very communal atmosphere, everyone is very friendly.  if your are after more luxury / private accomodation this might not be for you, but if you want meet people have some drinks this is your place.  wifi is good in certain spots, very close to train station which takes you straight downtown. and the breakfast is amazing too.  had a great time here üòä.

definitely a solid place to stay. walk to the train wasn‚Äôt too long. pool wasn‚Äôt very clean (leaves and stuff), but it was also april so ü§∑üèº‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è.  the dog in the lobby was the best part. she was perfect.  the kitchen was really small in the place i stayed. there was only 1 bathroom for like 15 people.  overall, i probably wouldn‚Äôt stay here again but i enjoyed it fine while there.

the best: free breakfast and laundry service, you can swim in the pool, the staff is friendly.    the worst: security, someone stole my personal towel. i know: it's just a towel but could had been a jewel or anything else...
i had a nice peaceful stay would definitely go back
the hostel's in a lovely area very close to the metro line. breakfast every morning was yum! and it has a savage pool ... and lots of great staff (hadi

they claim about a gap between their system and hostelworld. i booked a 4 bed room, the first night i get a bed at a 10 bed room, and the remaining nights at a 6 bed room. it is not critical, but if you booked something you expect that in return.    the neighborhood it is not the best, but it is okay.     pros:   -breakfast  -pool  -employees really friendly

they don't have any key for the entrance of the property (any person can get into and nobody will ask anything).no lockers anywhere. to get in/out  the common areas you have to cross the room of 6 people (poor them, no privacy at all!). my 1st day they took all my luggage while i wasn't in the building for "maintenance" and left in the office. and they charged me $15 more for "maintenance"  although everything was included in the price. although hostelworld don't mention it, they took it anyways

i prefer not to have bulldogs roaming the premises.  i also found one guest to be particularly invasive of my sense of well-being.  (a little too much like the bulldogs.)  the poolhouse based manager was consistently considerate and softspoken in a way that very much served the interest of a customer-facing organization.  i had my own set of planned (and unplanned) events, so i did not network with guests.  good, but be discerning, have a backup plan to avoid 'reality show' nightmare.
i was asked to wake up while sleeping and get out of my bed while the room was searched. then i was asked to empty my pockets.   how humiliating

this hostel is great. the rooms are nice, the people are nice, the complimentary breakfast is great.  there is a big swim pool. you just can't ask for more than that.      very clean too.     i put 5/5 for security, despite the regretable lack of lockers ( i never understood why some dorm doesn't have lockers. aren't they quite easy and cheap to build from square bookcase + adding little doors and lock ? ) , because it feels extremely safe here.       highly recommand.

the bathrooms and showers specifically need a good bleaching to get rid of moldy residues. that was pretty gross. was a bit intrusive with people walking through rooms at all hours of the night  when people are trying to sleep. there should be hours when these doors are locked to prevent this from occurring. from 2300-0600 would be good times to enforce this.

in all honesty, i met some truly unworthy people here. while the hostel was okay, i still felt uncomfortable at many moments. the staff weren't but really tentative to the needs of the guests and many times new guests would come to me seeking help with things that the staff should've been taking care of. i would like to say thanks to george, beatrice, mr. tony, barbara, abel and jesus for their great service and friendship during kyng stay! they took the time to actually speak and acknowledge us
the anderson estates provides value for money. for $25 per night i was able to get a free breakfast, free lunch, and access to an outdoor pool. the staff are friendly and nice and the place is tidy.
our ensweet was the only one working for around 20 ppl. they were walking through our room at all hours. some didn't even knock. the breakfast was yummy and staff were nice.
breakfast was absolutely amazing!! more of a halfway house rather than for travellers. other than that, truly enjoyed it!

the images shown here were't even close to reality. we were made to stay in a cottage outside the main mansion. we were assigned an 8 bed room although we had booked a 4 bed room. the reason given to us was that the hostel was overbooked since they do not have any way to limit the number of bookings.place is old, not well maintained, and shady. hostel staff was inefficient and breakfast never started on time. someone was sleeping on the couch in our lounge on one night. no lockers. roms dnt lock

great place to stay, made a lot of new friends from all over the world. free breakfast and wifi, and water too whenever you want. also you get to live in a piece of history, and they have really friendly dogs.

we booked to stay for two weeks, however ended up leaving after three hours. we arrived and were taken to an office where no one seemed to be working, and they didn't seem too interested in checking us in. once we had paid we were told we wouldn't be staying in the mansion in a four bed room, but were taken to the 'overflow' house in an eight bed room. it felt dirty and the atmosphere was very uncomfortable. they said we will get a refund, i have chased them up after two weeks and nothing.

this hostel has the potential to be beautiful, but our experience was definitely far from this. the room smelt unpleasant and was not clean. there was mould on the bathroom floor and it was never cleaned during the day. the rooms smelt of weed and had no security, lockers or anything of the sort. the security was the worst part and we felt uncomfortable leaving our possessions there during the day. the inside of the manor is quite nice. the staff were not very professional or helpful.

the pictures from this place are very deceiving. when we pulled up to the location, the mansion looked very sketchy and torn-down. the facility was not kept in maintenance. we had to go through the mansion (when i say mansion, just picture a huge house with paint chipping off and creepy people staring at your from their window), to get to the office space. the staff in the office also seemed very sketchy & super weird. we had to go through another room to get to our room which seemed really off.

felt my belongings were safe, but there are no lockers in the rooms.  metro stop is close-by. staff is cool and keen to help.  bad points:   - difference between hostelworld booking system and on site room allocation (never happened before)  - one of the rooms is kind of a preferred passage by guests of other rooms, and some of the guests used to leave the room door open while smoking next to it    likely to come back - a few improvements (see above) would make this place a "must go".
great atmosphere, i like the location and i have extended my stay.
great place to stay,good facilities and lovely people! although still not sure about broccoli for breakfast!!!  but great time had and would definitely stay again!! üòä

the anderson estates was great! it made my first hostel experience the best!! i made so many new friends in my house complex. and they serve breakfast in the morning if you get up early enough to get some;)
very accommodating during a busy weekend in the area. polite staff, youthful atmosphere, always something going on. wouldn't recommend staying extended periods longer than 2 weeks.
good place to stay for cheap when visiting or even moving to la. free breakfast, good wifi and close to metro line. would reccomend.

my only night at the hostel was just traumatizing. my dorm was outside the main property and, unlike it (where the normal backpackers like me were), it was populated by over 50years-old men who actually lived there permanently.  toilets and kitchen were dirty, messy and insalubrious. the whole hostel constantly smelled like weed.  i  left after the first night, mainly because i felt totally unsafe, and asked for a refund which fortunately was done.   breakfast is good and the staff is very kind.

this hostel is more than just a building. the vibe is chilled and super friendly. amazing (free) hot breakfast and coffee every morning. people want to be there and hang out. i loved having breakfast in the garden, sat chatting with people from all over the world, sharing stories and making plans. the staff are all down-to-earth, great people who are up for a laugh too! this will definitely be my accommodation on my next visit to la, for sure! my only problem was a lack of corkscrew! ha!

the attendant took me on a car chase trying to find an under-aged girl who was supposed to stay there but rose his "suspicious teen runawa" flag. its late, its dark, im in his vehicle. he said he needed to drive me over a half a mile to the house id be staying in away from my friend and our car. no house keys. nowhere to lock up my belongings. unsafe doesnt even begin to describe it. i chose not to stay, got a partial refund. that night, 3 blocks away there was a gun fight and people were shot.
it is a great place. i loved every moment of it. will definately go there again.
amazing value for money - the staff were gr8 espec hattie and barney. the piano was gr8 addition too and the breakfast was possibly the best ive ever had.

interesting place, most of the staff was great very helpful and easy going, some were a little selfish when it came to making noise... also a lot of the guests were very inconsiderate of other guest being rude or loud in the bedrooms or blow drying hair in commen areas etc. staff could of done more to help make guests be more considerate, breakfast was lovely just sometimes started late, ants problems, lots of non travelers just hanging out which is cool i guess overall ok experience good value
pro: location was ideal, right by the metro line which can take you pretty much anywhere. clean enough and breakfast was okay.  con: no house lock or lockers.

i really liked staying there; especially, i spent time with jazzey (the nice pitbull)... staff are really nice and friendly... you can meet people almost from allover the world... i did not like that there is no lockers although everything is safe. i had my laptop, and it was in my room most of the time, but if you have the option, do not bring it.    the breakfast was pretty nice, and they offer coffee and tea most of the day. there is a pool and you can use it anytime before 11pm.

positives  - lovely staff  - pool  - free breakfast  - very flexible if you want a longer stay  negatives   - one morning i got up at 8 just to go to the bathroom and came back to find my bed had been stripped. i was staying another night so couldn't understand the reason for this. the sheets weren't replaced for another couple of hours. also they took my pillowcase which i take on my travels.  - the room is cramped with beds, there were 11 beds in my room and 4 plug sockets.   - wifi not great

the property is unable to be locked, has no security and no lockers for valuables. there are people who live at the "hostel" who leave everything a mess. from having their belongings all over the dorm room, to not washing dishes after they cook or eat and leaving the shared bathrooms messy.  we were driven 3 blocks from the main house to our "hostel", you have to walk back and forth for breakfast or use of computers or pool. people who live there have 0 regard for guests sleeping or anything els

when you arrive you first have to change the location to another a few streets away. but the breakfast is in the first one. so you have to move. the hostel is dirty and the kitchen/living room is combined to the bedroom> might get loud in the middle of the night, whether the others want to cook (as they did when we've been there).
it was great. i thin one of the best place at la. the staffs and boss was very friendly. i like a lot

couldn't recommend this place more! it's cheap, awesome free breaky, so close to the metro and the staff are incredible. they accommodated us moving locations just so we could be closer to the pool and had so much info on everything la. if we are ever back in la this is where we will be!
awesome place to stay

special stay at this hostel. it's a mansion turned hostel managed by a group of cool people. mr anderson and the staffs are very helpful and friendly. location is not exactly town-centered but not far from the town (esp with car) about 10 mins walk to the nearest metro station, which are about 4-5 stations from the downtown. not very secured as compared to other hostel because there's no lock for the main gate / door. neighbourhood is residential area so it's quite safe.

i enjoyed my stay here and loved the breakfast.  i would of gave it a higher rating if the bathroom in my room were cleaner.  also my bed got infected with ants on my last day there.  if you could please clean the room and spray bug spray on the edges of the wall.

people in the hostel tend to do a lot of noise at nights, they don&#39;t really keep it quite at 11pm as they say. the rooms are not that clean, the floor was pretty dusty.  it&#39;s not in a center location, but you have a metro station within 10 minutes walk. it&#39;s not close to restaurants or places to go out at night. but it&#39;s a good area, lots of big houses, no people on the streets.  brakefast was nice, crew was nice too.  i guess it&#39;s a good value for your money.

this is false advertisement. there are no private rooms for 4 people available and the staff stated that this was hostel worlds fault not theirs (doubt it). the place was filthy. the staff were not helpful unless you spoke to mr.anderson.  there was no locks! it was close to the public transport but not worth it! i would not recommend this place at all!!
provides awesome breakfast! staff is awesome and so friendly!! my group got upgraded for free to a private room for the entire weekend! very fun and comfortable environment. totally recommend!
unlike the reviews on the web, security was not an issue. the environment is friendly and the staff is nice

at first, our first impressions of the hostel were positive. our welcome to the hostel was very warm - the staff were very professional and relaxed, and the process of checking in was very simple. location is okay.    as our weekend continued, our experience worsened. security is atrocious (no lockers at all). miscommunication with the staff led to one of the guys in our group to lose his bed in the middle of the night.     we wouldn't recommend this hostel to any traveler.

this is a very unique hostel. the location is very conveniently located close to a metro station. guests and staff were cool and the breakfast is free, but if you plan to stay longer, you will soon be bored by the same breakfast every day. but the value for money is unbeatable for the dorm beds. my only concern would be that theoretically everybody could walk in anytime, since the doors are open all the time and there is no possibility to lock up your stuff.
awesome hostel, great atmosphere and helpful staff, the only thing thats kinda strange is they dont have lockers. but overall, i reccomend it.
awful. no lockers no security. far away from anything interesting in a horrible area. in a run down old home.

very poor security, our doors didn't lock. some sleeping areas are in the open and there's nowhere to lock your things. the place was not the cleanest. for people who are not familiar with la the area may be a bit concerning.

on a budget it is a great place to stay, however the security is lacking a lot, do not leave any valuables as during our 4 day stay there were two cases of stealing, the breakfast is great value for money and the pool is a bonus.

i was in california to drop my daughter off at college.  i stayed here.  slept well after my 22-hr drive, and loved the place! other guests were quite civil, and the boss - mr anderson was a courteous, level-headed, and excellent host. yes, i would love to visit again, soon!

felt unsafe with no security. anyone could walk into the hostel and the rooms. the top bunks had no ladder to get on top. the room wasn&#39;t clean. the mattresses had holes in them and wasn&#39;t clean
really nice place,never had any problems with the room and breakfast was really nice too
it was great hostel after my nightmare in camelot inn. sam, the owner is a great guy.
it&#39;s ok for the price you pay there. i only recommend it if you don&#39;t have any other option.

there was a communication problem since we had booked a private room and were expecting privacy since we thought we paid more than we would have for a shared room. in the end we got a room for two nights which we were able to lock but it took a while. then we had to move into another room. the bathroom that came with that room had not been cleaned and there were used toiletries and towels in there. please check with the owner which rooms are available and whether the they match the offer on hw.c

location is okay given how big la is, staff were helpful and friendly enough and there was breakfast every morning (which was not the best and exactly the same every day). hoewever, security was atrocious. no locks on outside doors or room doors, and people who did have a private room with a lock on the door were forbidden from locking it! no lockers that i saw either, so you&#39;re constantly considering that any random stranger could walk into your room and steal your stuff.
not at all like the pictures on display. terrible beds, poor management (alloted one bed to multiple people) only decent part was breakfast. avoid at all cost.

the location, although is a quite and residential area, is pretty far from the main places of interest in la (hollywood, beverly hills and santa monica). you can arrive by public transport (10 min walking form expo/western station), but it is not a hostel i might recommend for doing tourism in la area for a few days, unless you have a car (but, i remind you, la traffic can be horrible).  the ambient was chill. cool and youth staff. the pool is probably the best of the hostel.

the breakfast is awesome and it&#39;s around 10 mins walk to metro ( a bit scary to walk at night ) . some of the staffs are very nice and fun to talk too. the room i stayed though was pretty dirty but all the other rooms were so clean and i stayed on the 2nd floor with only one bathroom in the other room so sometimes i couldn&#39;t use it so i have to walk to the pool just to use the bathroom but i enjoyed the stay. it&#39;s really affordable and worth it. + main gate was never locked but it&#39;s safe.
i have had my best time there and my vacation in cali was fab  the place is nice and the people too , i hope come back.soon

good facilities and great breakfast but little security with doors being open onto the main street and no lockers and keys for rooms. everyone was friendly and helpful and me and my friends enjoyed our stay here. metro was close enough to hostel to get around la easily and parking on the road was fine as well. films in the evening with snacks were offered as well. good for price but don't have high expectations. although free breakfast was amazing!

the people who run and work in the hostel are so nice and everyone who stays there is so friendly. the free breakfast you get every morning is amazing especially the waffles i need that recipe!! you can easily get to the tram which takes you into downtown and it&#39;s a couple of stops from lots of museums. i would defiantly stay here again
good for price but lacking in security for personal belongings. other guests had things stolen from.bags whilst here.
pretty good place. close to the metro. nice swimming pool. great breakfast. free towels. free bottle water. free washing machine. amazing !!! i will stay here again when i come back to los angeles.

the cottage is the main property with the pool, free breakfast, big screen, and dj. the ensuite is three blocks away, consisting of four buildings, but was unfortunately under construction during my stay, which started at 8am. there was also an ant infestation, mainly in the kitchen, and only 1/4 stove tops worked. and parking was competitive/limited.    everything else was great! two miles from shopping strips, grocery, and clothing stores. can see the hollywood sign from the ensuite!
best accommodation i&#39;ve visited lately :) great staff, wicked pad, pretty much unreal. i will recommend to friends. thanks !!

a wonderful, old, historic, very nice place to stay.  mr eddie anderson is a wonderful man.  just one small thing bothered me ...... rooms cannot lock.  although it is very safe. otherwise, i will sure stay there again.  and i give them 100%.

there is no security at this hostel at all! neither the house, nor the room, nor the bath room could be locked and there were no lockers available to rent. that the hostel is in fact a mansion with a pool does not compensate this. location is ok for la with a metro stop nearby but staying in that neighbourhood with no security was uncomfortable. everything usually looked clean, but it would be great if shelves and cupboards were dusted regularly, so that they could actually be used for storage.

anderson estates is not a hostel in the typical sense. there is the main mansion where the pool/yard is located. as well, mr. anderson owns several houses in the area where bunk beds have been set up. some of the beds are set up in bedrooms, but bunk beds are also set up in open areas with zero privacy.    there is absolutely zero security! the house and bedroom could not be locked, and there were no storage lockers for your items. considering the sketchy neighborhood, this is very worrying.

the free breakfast was great always left full. location is a good as you&#39;re going to get in la, close to the metro line and close to a big supermarket. the staff didn&#39;t really help or hinder it seemed like it was run by a group of mates rather than a actual staff. best price you&#39;re going to get in la

everyone is so friendly! great place to meet other travellers. nicely prepared free breakfast! the location is convenient for tourist attractions in different directions. i would definitely recommend this place.
it was good :)

+extremly nice spot with swimming pool!  +best place to meet amazing people from all horizons  +breakfast is amazing  +mr. anderson and his team are really nice, and offer a lot of extras (cutting gopro movies service!)    -secondary houses very poorly isolated. in summer it's like being in an oven. also no lockers nor locks, basically any random person could walk into these houses  -the block is a little away from the main attractions, but well connected by the train  -shopping facilities limited

one of the strangest hostels i've ever stayed at. part hostel - part construction site where the mansion owner provides free accomodation for those working on his house. these individuals drink most nights and can be very loud and abusive. wouldn't reccomend staying here, but it is fairly close to the expo/western metro station.
it was good overall but the first day they put me to sleep at the living room on a horrible air mattress and the wi-fi doesn&#39;t work very well.
i have chosen it because it was quite cheap, but when i came i felt like a king :)  you have pool, great breakfast, kitchen, wifi, showers, nice staff and 2 cute dogs. what do you need more?

we booked two gender specific dorm rooms so were pleasantly surprised when we ended up in a private dorm.  we were in one of the secondary houses (not the main mansion). beds were comfy and had a shared ensuite, although other people accessed it via our room. there was next to no security! door to house was never locked and normally open, couldn&#39;t lock our bedroom door from the outside and there were no lockers. breakfast at the mansion house was nice and there was a pool use. near metro stop
nice place with a pool, great staff, good price, great breakfast!

they are still under construction.   so thay made noisy sound every morning.   there is no 24hrs front desk service.   the first day, we got the temperory room that there is no privacy as well as many people passed by our room to get their room and bathroom.  second day, there is no ladder on our bed going up. even if i asked staff already, thay didnt fix.  there are some aunts in my bed and i saw a cockroach bathroom.   i felt scary near hostel. the price was cheap but not wealthy.

i have stayed in hostels all over the world . i can truthfully say this is one of the best places i have stayed and certainly one of the best values . a clean room, clean bathroom, excellent wi-fi, a good breakfast, a customer useable computer and general atmosphere makes this one of the best deals you will find in los angeles ever . i highly recommend this hostel and certainly plan to stay there again when i am passing through los angeles again.l.p.

probably the cheapest place to stay in la. free laundry and breakfast in the morning! definitely a college party-type atmosphere, so prepare for that, especially if staying in a dorm room. staff (and other guests) could be more considerate (what's with continually leaving the door to the living room wide open and blasting the tv at all hours, especially when people are trying to sleep???). mr. anderson himself is a great guy. location isn't so good‚Äînear usc‚Äîbut that's the nature of la.

free breakfast, swimming pool and a large garden area are all bonuses on top of a comfortable hostel close to a metro station. the beds are comfortable and the bathroom areas are clean. however the kitchen area is gross towards the end of the day and there are no lockers or even locks on the bedroom doors. also the front door is left open 24/7 so theoretically anyone could walk in. luckily i had no problems with my things while i was there though.

i made a good choice to stay here.  to think i paid $20 to stay in a mansion, where hollywood stars used to visit, including bob hope and marilyn monroe according to mr anderson.  great breakfast, much better than all the other hostels i have stayed in the us.  the staff was excellent.   facilities include a large pool which i hope to use next time if the weather is warmer.

the stay here was awesome, although i think people, especially other females, need to know to be a little careful in the area. i had quite a few people around la tell me to be careful in the area and not keep my phone out while walking around because people have been known to swipe them.   other than that i had no problems. laid back with a pool, 10 min walk from the train and buses, takes about an hour to get to most places which is common when taking transportation anywhere in la.

worst hostel ever. i was coming from out of town for work and knew id have a late check in. called 2 numbers more than 4 times with no answer or voicemail to leave message. emailed to ask about the late check in and they said it was fine. i got there and no one was there to check me in. i stayed for three days without checking in. there are no locks on any doors. communication is absolutely terrible & none of the staff know whats going on and are unable to help even when they try. complete mess

i stayed in the private room so security wasn&#39;t a problem. but the stay was very nice. wifi runs decently, the walk to the metro is about 15 minutes though so get ready for that. overall it was a good stay, i didn&#39;t have the free breakfast, but i know they have it so thats also a plus.

very strange place. didn&#39;t feel comfortable at all. booked for 3 nights but only stayed 2 because i felt unsafe. no locks on the front door. no lockers in the rooms. the second night a really creepy man came into our room around 10.30pm. the staff said it was too late to check him in and just let him into our room without knowing who he was. i didn&#39;t want to stay in the same room as he, and luckily the staff did understand and asked him to leave. breakfast is ok.wifi ok.close to public transport

the anderson estates is definitely one of the stranger hostels i&#39;ve stayed at however it certainly has a lot of positives, the staff are really helpful, i met great people there, free breakfast and laundry and you even have a swimming pool and gym equipment. negatives are i didn&#39;t feel security was very tight, it was like anyone could come and go whenever plus the location isn&#39;t central at all although near a metro stop. would still recommend as it is the cheapest place in l.a

not bad for the price. has a pool & the people are friendly. but people need to learn to knock on your door not just bust in on you. not the best location for site seeing. most of the time you&#39;ll need to call a cab or use uber/lyft. but overall it was a good experience. i&#39;d stay again.  bostonbyrd
i was doing laundry when i went to check on it someone was in the process of taking it out.
10 plus if you or anyone you know needs a reliable place for what ever reason i highly recommend staying there very trust worthy.

don't let the number decide your trip - the value of this place far outweighed the issues i did have with this place. if i was ever staying in la again i would hands down stay here every time. but: security is lacking. no keys, no lockers. bring a cable/bag lock! the staff are actually great but management is a bit weird... it feels like there's no permanent workers so no one really knows some things  overall its the best hostel for your money in la, but definitely needs a bit more work!

nice place, but is not a mansion, the rooms are in a little house near to the swimming pool. the staff was volunteers from france very bad face, the breakfast is bad food, the only good is wafles but only 1 for person.   the please doesnt have lockers, and everybody pass for your room.  the doors doesnt have lock.  also the staff put the tv in the night too high.    the neighbourhood is nice and you have the metro close.
beautiful  structure but not very clean.dust below beds.  reception staff not   very  friendly

this is my first experience with a hostel. i&#39;ve met some nice and interesting people at anderson estates. i believe there should be more involvement on a managerial level. the breakfast is always great. there is prompt service if any needs arise. i have found it humbling and appreciated the home.

it&#39;s a great place to stay: free breakfast, friendly staff, a pool and very clean rooms. i travel a lot even though i am los angeles based here. it&#39;s comforting to know that i have a &#34;home&#34; to stay at that is not only affordable, it&#39;s a great to be in. i enjoy the place and appreciate the location where i can drive to work within a reasonable distance.  if i have any concerns, joanne will take care of it. i know that i am listened to and valued as a guest. i stay here often. thank you!
this is a nice hostel, with great friendly staff. the only downside is that as a solo traveller it is harder to meet people there.

the property in itself is extraordinary, and the amenities are very good and free. however the staff could be a bit unorganized, and they do not have lockers in the rooms.   also the location isn&#39;t exactly central, but it is however close to a metro station.   parking is nice as well.   i enjoyed my stay there, and would recommend.

the people were awesome and so was the breakfast! it&#39;s hard to tell who&#39;s on the staff and who isn&#39;t but if you ask around you can always get help from a friendly staff member. if you get drunk with the french people you&#39;ll probably end up getting thrown into the pool... all in good fun! this place was great!

bit of a strange vibe, and it's very much in the suburbs. close to train line though and the neighbourhood is alright. facilities made available to dorm customers are pretty average - i kind of felt like i was intruding tbh, though people were all nice, it's less travellers and more people in between houses or moving to la that seem to stay in the dorms. nice looking pool, comfy beds and everything cleaned daily, can't comment on the breakfast because i'm vegan but people seemed to enjoy it.

the place looked dark and uninviting.  as we walked the facility we felt unsafe and concerned about how easy it was for people to come in and out of the property.      we expected to see travelers like ourselfs but instead we saw a lot of young people just hanging around and it looked like they had been living there for a while.  the place looked like a college dorm after a house party.      we want our deposit back because what was been advertised is not what we witnessed.

the anderson estates hostel is a beautiful place to visit.     when i arrived i wasnt enable to check in, but some employees (there are volunteers from workaway) did help me to get a bed. everybody was telling me that the breakfast is good, but im used to do a dutch breakfast.. so it wasnt good for me. it is very sweet and i didnt like the way they serve breakfast. the location is good, like everything in the us... you have to travel a long distance. after all its a good and &#34;cheap&#34; hostel.
it was confusing trying to utilize this hostel - bathrooms were not clearly marked, one of the pool showers was lacking a shower curtain.
i was really happy with my stay at the anderson estates, you have everything what you need. nice room, quiet and great breakfast. i would definitely recommend this place to anyone.

wow! one of the best hostels in the world! it's five times larger than most hostels, with many living rooms and houses and hangout places, gym equipments, free self-laundry, two kitchens for guests, tvs, and a playstation. our 8 bunk-beds room and private bathroom is cleaned daily. i had a free delicious breakfast buffet every morning while watching tv in a big dining room in front of a beautiful swimming pool. the staff is very nice and friendly. highest luxury for lowest cost! need i say more?

when i got there every one was really nice. i stayed in the 9-bed mixed dorm for two weeks, and even had the room to myself a few nights. there's two huge houses, lots of couches, very comfortable. right next to the metro train, which was very convenient. the place was so big that it had 3 different wifi passwords, but they all had strong signals, and i was  streaming all the european soccer games to my phone no problem. they leave the coffee and tea out all day, and the free breakfast was great
all in all a nice hostel.. only thing is that its a bit fare away from everything..
very good
i enjoyed my stay at the anderson estates. the staff is friendly, excellent breakfast, and the other guests we&#39;re great to live with. i will definitely stay here again!

when you think of a hostel, you think of a happy, welcoming, relaxing, affordable experience. well this place did that for me, i have been to so many hostels in my life and never one like this. i've seen the reviews on here, and some have said the neighborhood is bad and others have said the staff is mean. since i hwvhwve been here i have been given the upmost respect by every single individual on the facilities from the staff to the guests.

amazing loved my stay the dog is funny , staff are great and friendly i stayed in the 9 bed mix dorm and at some points it was all to myself, you have to stay here there's a pool and the breakfast well hot bacon sausage and egg with waffles covered in chocolate cream and strawberries .... it's very much a hidden gem ... oh did i not mention the price yet !  i payed $20/¬£14 and stayed for 9 nights cheap supermarket 10 min stroll ... why are you still reading this ... book up don't be a fool! ‚ò∫Ô∏è
great hostess!
had a wonderful the place is clean , the staff are great and the breakfast is awesome ! won't find anyplace offering the same in la
stayed here on multiple different occasions. located close to metro line. great backyard with pool. friendly staff.
a bit unprofessional staff, but sweet!! they make you really nice breakfast every morning and it's near the metro
we booked it for 9 dollars a night and it was doubled price we had to pay!!!!

this is not a hostel. no lockers and doors are open all day and night. near the most dangerous district of la. unprepared staff. many guests/residents trying to get jobs in la. room with dirty carpet. worsened my allergy. good breakfast.
they told me the site was faked and stole my money , they kicked out me and insulted me , very impolite

the internet didn't match with the booking they made on their own. we booked for 10 night but couldn't get more than 2. they kicked people out same day as us because a big groupe were the day after. we waited for one and a half hour on the receive they promised me the day before.   we haven't no stairs to our bed and than have to climb up every night.   the lock on the restroom didn't work and the shower was grose.     the breakfast in the morning was excellent - so good!!

it was more of a home for people wanting to move to la. staff weren't very helpful with tourist attractions or pu lic transport knowledge. had to figure it out on my own. breakfast was good, though self service would've been quicker

t is more upscale than most of the motels in the los angeles area, close to shopping and practically everything required for a comfortable life style. for the price i am paying for 4 bed/room this place is preferable to anywhere else i would rather be. the room mates are polite, considerate and happy when we gather around mrs. anderson. i will stay here as long as i want.  there is also a big beautiful swimming pool where anyone is allowed, a full staff to serve breakfast and drinks and 24 hour r

very great place! near from the city center, you sleep inside a big american house : big rooms, kitchen, laundry (also for free!), a rest room (sofa, tv), swimming pool in the garden, two clean bathrooms for dormitory. the mattress in dormitory are comfortable. the breakfast is included (egg, bacon, pankake, strawberry, coffe, orange juice,...). great for backpackers. the owner can offer you a job inside the guesthouse so that you can stay longer witthout paying your room!
cheap and cheerful but in a very dodgy area. easy access to the metro though
lovely place, great breakfast included and really nice staff. would definetely recommend it to others. and the price is soooo good!

make no mistake... this is not a hostel! 1) the west adams district of l.a. is a crime-ridden, drug-infested ghetto, where every house has bars on the windows and the nearest bus stop is 2km away. 2) there are no lockers, and the bunk beds are crammed less than a meter between each other. 3) god knows what property you'll be placed in. the tiny house i stayed at had 22 beds and only one bathroom. 4) forget about meeting tourists. most everyone are actor wanna-be's or indigent locals.

i missed my flight from berlin to lax, so sadly, i'm unable to leave a cogent review. but i would like to think they are good people. this is why i'm forced to leave an "average" report, having no other idea of what to suggest.

the room that i was have just 2 beds with a bathroom, and all of my floor could use the bathroom. however, i didn't like the idea of all the floor use the bathroom, because i was with my friend in the room, and i thought that this bathroom it was just for us. i suggest to do a bathroom for the others rooms or make the bathroom of this room just for the room. also, i didn't like the cleanliness of the bathroom, because we stayed for 5 days, and the bathroom wasn't cleaned any time.

i never received a key that worked for the front door while at the hostel. several nights i was locked out of the building, and had to ask to be let in.     the younger staff from other countries were great -- very nice, and accommodating. some of the older staff seemed a bit curt with guests.
fantastic staff, friendly and helpful

nice mansion,relaxed,feels like at home,tv,pool,kitchen,close to metro/train station,great to stay in groups,atmosphere a bit boring for one traveler,of course it depends of currently residing guests.staff not so attentive,also managing system with beds for guests disorderly,feels like you're part of the staff and they can move you to another room suddenly when they want to,there is no any cattle to prepare tea/coffee,which is strange..
it was great! thanks guys for everything! hope to go again soon.
extremly dissapointing. staff ignored me totaly. this is not a backpacker hostel at all, more like a long term housing. would really not recomend to travellers.

this was an odd sort of hostel, in that it was segregated into a few different houses. the "office" was a house across the road from the main building, and often there wasn't anyone there to ask questions. they also don't provide any maps or visitor guids or tourist info.   i had to ask about 3 times to have clean sheets put on the bed, the management doesn't seem very well structured.  otherwise it was a very nice place to stay.

i have been staying at two different locations, the rochester house is under going some upgrades and i look forward to seeing the place when their finished. the second house is very nice and the other people staying here are friendly and considerate of the other guests. i am moving to another one of the many other properties that they own and if its as nice as the other two i've been in then i look forward to staying there.  its nice to know that they have so many different locations.

the hostel is nice, we stayed in a 6 beds room, the room was really big but the bathroom was in another room (occupied, so it was awkward). but people were nice.   and the location was awful too far from everything, 30 minutes by taxi and more than 1 hour by public transportation.
very good hostel and very kind staff!!!  see and you won't be disappoint.
it's a really nice place. it's a little bit caotic, but there are just on the beginning. if there are done the place is probably really nice. the breakfast is the best! just awesome!
there is no brackfast in correct time, i booked a room with 4 beds but when i arrived there the room had 8 beds, local reform. gates open 24 hours and there is no security.

they lied about their facilities. first of all there wasn't 3 meals a day. they place is still under going it's refurbishment so there is no pool nor is the rooms as they looked in the pictures (now they have been updated) the kitchen was a mess, nothing was there for you to use.     management was rarely home. was fed up answering the door to strangers wanting to speak to the  . the front door wasn't locked at night. extremely unsafe especially in jefferson, a rough area.

this hostel was nothing like advertised on the website, the actual hotel was being refurbished so we were directed to a grubby little house nearby which didn't have pillows or breakfast and was generally very run down. we were then told there was aistake in the booking process and we actually had to pay four times the advertised price! needless to say we left quickly and found somewhere else. do not stay here.

i booked this hostel for the price, but when we check-in they told us they was a mistake with the price and it sould be double price , so we stayed 1 night and then moved downtown where it was same price .
